intro: Saussurea lacostei, commonly known as the lacostei yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
